candidates.title: perf(common): Use `fxhash` everywhere
candidates.body:
Description:

To avoid a breaking change, I created a cargo feature that can be used to change hasher.

This leads to about 8% perf improvements on m1 max macbook pro 64gb

candidates.title: perf(es/minifier): Use fxhash for integers
candidates.body:
Description:

 - `Id` is treated as integer, as `JsWord` and `SyntaxContext` are both integer.

**Related issue (if exists):**

candidates.title: perf(es/minifier): Make mangler faster by merging hash sets into one
candidates.body: **Description:** I'm trying to reproduce benchmark results in https://github.com/privatenumber/minification-benchmarks **Related issue (if exists):** --- With `RAYON_NUM_THREADS=2` ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/29931815/158005079-5cef38f5-d606-4128-af0f-77a25cb2d15f.png) --- After profiling, I improved the performance a lot. I merged two hashsets into one. - antd: 2.4s => 1.7045s - d3: 172ms => 155.72ms - echarts: 1.1s => 894.69ms - jquery: 35ms => 34.951ms - lodash: 38.5ms => 39.341ms - moment: 21ms => 19.915ms - react: 8ms => 7.7071ms - terser: 87.132ms => 85.408ms - three: 205ms => 191.21 ms - typescript: 6.1s => 4.2862 s - victory: 691ms => 517.86 ms - vue: => 47.745ms

candidates.title: build(cargo): set workspace default members
candidates.body:
<!-- Note: CI script will automatically rebase your PR so please do not rebase unless required -->

<!-- Thanks for submitting a pull request! Please provide enough information so that others can review your pull request. -->

**Description:**

Possible approaches for https://github.com/swc-project/swc/pull/3977 : 

It's non-fancy workaround. Basically, omit offending package (node / wasm) from default workspace build selection. `cargo build` skips those and we have to manually run each build scripts (`npm run build` for /node, `scripts/build.sh` for /wasm). To get the right binary those scripts are needed anyway, however I'm not sure about implications like `cargo check` _may_ miss to run over those packages. 

The other approach is having better build system to control build scripts instead of cargo. Given the scope of the work we need to achieve here, that's something I'd like to defer for now unless it shows visible gains for us.

**Related issue (if exists):**

candidates.title: fix(es/preset-env): Fix compilation issue
candidates.body:
**Description:**

I added copy script to the `prepare` yarn script so invoking `yarn` will update the json files.

**Related issue (if exists):**

 - Closes #3971

candidates.title: Upgrade dependencies, mainly lexical for better performance
candidates.body:
## Before

### Lexer
test three         ... bench:  14,350,033 ns/iter (+/- 767,897) = 82 MB/s

### Parser:
test three         ... bench:  27,030,841 ns/iter (+/- 765,058) = 43 MB/s

## After

### Lexer
test three         ... bench:  14,089,720 ns/iter (+/- 667,112) = 84 MB/s

### Parser
test three         ... bench:  26,409,095 ns/iter (+/- 1,086,535) = 44 MB/s

candidates.title: Feat source map supports
candidates.body:
<!-- Note: CI script will automatically rebase your PR so please do not rebase unless required -->

<!-- Thanks for submitting a pull request! Please provide enough information so that others can review your pull request. -->

**Description:**

Feat:
- Supports source maps in codegen
- Supports `index_width`, `index_type` and `linefeed`
- Refactor code and simplify basic witter to use only necessary functions
- Update tests with new fancy output
- Bug fixes in codegen around span

There are still bugs in source map, but let's start to fix them in other PRs

**BREAKING CHANGE:**

Yes

**Related issue (if exists):**

No

candidates.title: build(package): bump up tracing
candidates.body:
<!-- Note: CI script will automatically rebase your PR so please do not rebase unless required -->

<!-- Thanks for submitting a pull request! Please provide enough information so that others can review your pull request. -->

**Description:**

https://github.com/tokio-rs/tracing/blob/v0.1.x/tracing/CHANGELOG.md#0132-march-8th-2022

> Reduced Drop overhead for disabled spans ([#1974](https://github.com/tokio-rs/tracing/pull/1974))

Related with https://github.com/swc-project/swc/pull/3911, timely upstream update we can try bump & see if it makes diff for us.

candidates.title: perf(es): Add fast memory deallocator
candidates.body:
**Description:**



## Initial, main branch

```
running 8 tests
test angular       ... bench:   7,431,479 ns/iter (+/- 198,154) = 96 MB/s
test backbone      ... bench:   1,041,447 ns/iter (+/- 27,429) = 57 MB/s
test colors        ... bench:      14,379 ns/iter (+/- 257) = 80 MB/s
test jquery        ... bench:   5,720,166 ns/iter (+/- 141,980) = 46 MB/s
test jquery_mobile ... bench:   9,074,520 ns/iter (+/- 123,993) = 49 MB/s
test mootools      ... bench:   4,396,554 ns/iter (+/- 104,997) = 36 MB/s
test underscore    ... bench:     897,749 ns/iter (+/- 17,875) = 48 MB/s
test yui           ... bench:   4,301,158 ns/iter (+/- 98,899) = 78 MB/s
```

candidates.title: fix(es/module): export update expr for bigint
candidates.body:
<!-- Note: CI script will automatically rebase your PR so please do not rebase unless required -->

<!-- Thanks for submitting a pull request! Please provide enough information so that others can review your pull request. -->

**Description:**

For bigint,
`ident ++` cannot be transformed into `ident = ident + 1`

```javascript
export let foo = 1n;

foo++;
```

candidates.title: feat(css/lints): Allow regex in "ignore list"
candidates.body:
<!-- Note: CI script will automatically rebase your PR so please do not rebase unless required -->

<!-- Thanks for submitting a pull request! Please provide enough information so that others can review your pull request. -->

**Description:**

In Stylelint, some rules, for example [`at-rule-no-unknown`](https://stylelint.io/user-guide/rules/list/at-rule-no-unknown), allow regular expressions in configuration, and this PR implemented that feature.

**BREAKING CHANGE:**

API of `swc_css_lints` has breaking changes, because its function signature has changed.
